summary: Email chain between American Express Global Security personnel discussing technical issues with sharing documents related to Epstein. The emails show coordination to provide Epstein-related materials, likely financial records, to an external recipient, possibly from law enforcement.

persons.name: Robert T Curran
persons.role: Director/Investigations at American Express Global Security
persons.context: He is coordinating the sending of Epstein-related documents from American Express to an external recipient and mentions technical issues.

persons.name: Yui Chow
persons.role: Employee at American Express (office of Robert Curran)
persons.context: Sent emails with links to AmEx materials related to Epstein; the recipient found her folder easiest to access.

persons.name: Kristina Lee Hendrickson
persons.role: Manager, Growth Assignment Lead - Special Investigations, Financial Intelligence Unit, Global Financial Crimes Compliance at American Express
persons.context: She is involved in sending Epstein-related information and is listed as a contact for American Express Global Security.

connections.description: Yui Chow is from Robert Curran's office at American Express, assisting in sending Epstein-related documents.
Both are American Express Global Security/Financial Crimes Compliance personnel coordinating on providing Epstein-related materials.
Both are involved in sending Epstein-related document links from American Express to an external recipient.

events.title: Secure message about Epstein
events.description: A secure, encrypted email from the Department of Justice (or related) regarding Epstein was sent to Kristina Hendrickson, requiring access by a specific date.

events.title: Document sharing coordination
events.description: Multiple emails exchanged about sending Epstein-related American Express documents, with technical access issues reported.

events.title: Status update on document access
events.description: An email summarizes receipt of multiple emails with links to AmEx Epstein materials, successful downloads from some senders, and ongoing technical issues with others.

locations: New York (American Express Global Security office)
Phoenix, AZ 85027 (American Express Global Financial Crimes Compliance office)
keyFacts: American Express Global Security and Financial Crimes Compliance personnel were actively sharing Epstein-related documents in July 2019.
The external recipient referenced prior correspondence on cases, suggesting an ongoing investigative relationship.
Technical difficulties were encountered in accessing shared document links, indicating secure or restricted data transfer.
A secure message from the Department of Justice regarding Epstein was sent to American Express on July 11, 2019, with an expiration date for access.
The emails demonstrate American Express's internal coordination to provide financial records or investigative materials related to Epstein.
